78501.name: Helvetesfortet
78501.description:
From the back of the book (Swedish):

Det erebiska året 612 börja nu lida mot sitt slut, och alla som följt våra äventyr i Ereb Altor vet att den fruktade Vicotnik Ärkemagikern enligt profetiorna nu skall låta sitt väldiga korståg – den nidländska reningen – avmarschera. Vintern har dock kommit utan några orosmoln i öster, och det blir rollpersonernas uppdrag att utreda var det egentlig är som händer.

Helvetesfortet är den fristående första delen av triologin "Den nidländska reningen" - en episk hjälteberättelse der NI är hjältarna.
User translation:

Title: The Hell Fort

The Erebian year of 612 is now coming to an end, and everyone who has followed our adventures in Ereb Altor knows that the feared Vicotnik the Arch-mage is now, according to the prophecies, going to order his mighty crusade – The Nidlandic Cleansing – to march off. Although, the winter has come without any dark clouds in the east, and it will be the player characters' mission to investigate what is going on.

"Helvetesfortet" is the independent first part of the trilogy "The Nidlandic Cleansing" - an epic tale were YOU are the heroes.

78502.name: Formula One 2000
78502.description:
Formula One 2000 is a racing game in the Formula One series of video games. It is also the only game of the series, known to be made on a non-Sony console (Game Boy Color). Drivers appearing on the front cover are Mika Häkkinen (McLaren) and Jarno Trulli (Jordan).

Formula One 2000 contained the new "arcade" mode, which had been missing from its predecessor, Formula One 99. This arcade mode seemed more similar in style to WipEout—tracks were grouped into "location zones" with futuristic-sounding names and cars were grouped into series. The player began on the easier courses with the worst cars, before unlocking the more difficult courses and the better cars. Bonus images could be unlocked as an incentive to win races.

The simulation mode, however, had begun to stagnate. Despite the introduction of pit-stop strategies and an improved cockpit view, these were quite superficial changes in the grand scheme of things. Critics and gamers alike were beginning to tire of Formula One games, especially considering that this version was not the only game on the market. By this time, people complained about the fact that every game had the same cars and tracks, and the differences between years were minimal. However, people continued to buy Formula One games to a great extent, if not quite to the same extent as the mid-1990s.

It was clear by this time that in order to keep to Formula One series interesting, developers had to create more interesting arcade modes and unlockables.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Formula_One_2000_(video_game),&...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78503.name: MechWarrior (1989)
78503.description:
User Summary

MechWarrior was the first video game to offer the player a chance to pilot a BattleMech from the view of a pilot (a MechWarrior). With this game the player has a great deal of freedom when compared to many of the follow-up MechWarrior games, which include choosing missions, buying & selling 'Mechs and parts, hiring lance-mates, and traveling throughout the Inner Sphere. Underneath the major game mechanics, the player had the option of following a role playing style story arc that would unfold over a five-year (game time) period.

The game was ported to the Japanese Sharp X68000 home computer in 1992 under the name Battletech.

78504.name: Hong Kong Mahjong
78504.description:
User Summary

Software version of this classic game with authentic Hong Kong style rules and scoring. Players can choose from twelve different opponents of varying skill levels. Vocals and animations are included, as well as a variety of tile and background styles.

78505.name: Gridders
78505.description:
Game Instruction Manual

YOUR MIND IS THE KEY TO SUCCESS

Gidders is the adventure/puzzel game that tests your cleverness and creativity inside interactive 3D worlds. As Zack you will enter the Gridder Corporation factory consisting of 36 levels of grids, each 16 x 16 squares. Your objective on each level is to solve it by collecting the required number of Pyramid Keys. You accomplish this by interacting with the tumbling Gridders. After you've solved the level you must locate the diamond shaped portal that transports you to the next level. Continue to descend grid by grid toward your final fate and the mystery of the factory. Each level can be solved in more than one way and the solutions become more challenging with every grid. You cannot advance to the next level until the current one is solved. Dramatic animated sequences between the levels provide plot twists.

78506.name: Formula One 2001
78506.description:
Formula One 2001 is a racing game in the Formula One series of computer and video games. It was released for the PlayStation and PlayStation 2. It was the first game to support the Logitech racing wheel (a.k.a GT Force) (PS2 only).

Formula One 2001 was the last simulation Formula One game to appear on the PSone (as the PlayStation had become known by that point, to differentiate it from the PlayStation 2). It was also the last game in the series released in the United States/Canada region before the 2005 release of F1 Grand Prix.

The game's "arcade" mode followed a similar line to that of Formula One 2000, although incentives were now offered in the form of upgrades to the player's car.

A new mode—"Challenge" mode—was introduced. In Challenge mode, players were given a lap around Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps in Jenson Button's Benetton. Players who achieved a fast lap time were given a verification code, and were given the opportunity to post their winning times on the Internet to compare their times to other people's.

In some editions, a DVD was given for free. The DVD offers a commentated review of the 2000 Formula One season, race by race, with the option to toggle between viewing the main stream, an on-board car camera, view the pitline or see on-screen data such as lap times and positions. These features were used in the former pay-per-view F1 Digital+'s interactive coverage.

The PlayStation version was once again developed by Studio 33, while the PlayStation 2 version was developed by Sony Studio Liverpool.

It is worth noting that throughout the game the Minardi driver Tarso Marques' name is not mentioned in the commentary. 'Minardi' is used instead.

Formula One 2001 is the first game for PlayStation 2.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Formula_One_2001_(video_game),&...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78507.name: Midgard 1

rpgissuearticle.108492: Ein Blick zurück und nach vorne

78507.description:
user summary

Midgard 1 is the first German RPG and was published in 1981. The game was published by "Verlag für F & SF-Spiele". The later published RPG "Das Schwarze Auge" quickly dominated the German RPG market for a while as it was published by a then huge board game publisher (Schmidt Spiele) which got "Das schwarze Auge" onto the shelf of nearly every toy store. Hence, only be sold via hobby stores, Midgard became the lesser known RPG in Germany.

Taken from the preface of the game:

"MIDGARD ist das erste eigenständige deutsche Fantasy-Rollenspiel. Im Gegensatz zu anderen deutschsprachigen Fantasy-Rollenspiel-Regelwerken handelt es sich bei Midgard nicht um eine in kleiner Auflage und für den Privatgebrauch angefertigten Übersetzung oder erweiterte Bearbeitung eines amerikanischen und englischen Rollenspielsystems. Wesentliche Aspekte der Regeln wurden eigens für MIDGARD entwickelt, um die innere Logik des Spiels und die Beziehungen zwischen den Spielvorgängen, und dem was sie simulieren sollen, zu verbessern."

The first edition of Midgard was not set on the later world "Midgard", but the action took place in "Magira".

The rulebook includes the following chapters:

- Spielfiguren (characters)
- Fertigkeiten (skills)
- Abenteuer (adventure)
- Kampf (combat)
- Zauber (magic)
- Erfahrung (experience)
- Türen und Fallen (doors and traps)
- Preislisten (price lists)
- Spruchrollen (magic scrolls)

78508.name: Formula One Arcade
78508.description:
Formula One Arcade is a racing video game developed by Studio 33 and published by Sony Computer Entertainment for the PlayStation. The drivers featured on the front cover, from left to right, are Eddie Irvine, Michael Schumacher and Jarno Trulli.

Formula One Arcade is based on the 2001 season, the game was centered around hectic racing action and is considered unrealistic [1]. Players compete in a quick race of just a few laps , collecting checkpoints to keep the time and have to collect pickups such as a speed boost (which make the car faster), large tires (which gives the car more grip) and shields (which make the car invulnerable).

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Formula_One_Arcade,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78509.name: Road Rash (1991/8 bit systems)

videogameversion.184964: North American Game Boy Color edition

78509.description:
Road Rash is the name of a motorcycle-racing video game series by Electronic Arts, in which the player participates in violent illegal street races. The game was originally released for the Sega Mega Drive/Genesis, but was ported to several other systems. Six different games were released from 1991 to 1999, and a 2004 licensed port for the Game Boy Advance was released. Road Rash and two of its sequels later appeared on the EA Replay collection for the PSP.

The game's title is based on the slang term for the severe friction burns that can occur in a motorcycling fall where skin comes into contact with the ground at high speed.

Presented in a third-person view similar to Hang-On, the player competes in illegal road races and must finish in the top 3 places in every race in order to proceed to the next level. As levels progress, the opponents ride faster, fight harder and the tracks are longer and more dangerous. Placing in each race gives a certain amount of money which increases considerably as levels progress. This money allows the player to buy faster bikes which are needed to stay competitive. The game is over if the player can't pay for the repairs when their motorcycle is wrecked, or can't pay the fine for being arrested.

Source: Wikipedia, Road Rash , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78510.name: Melindors återkomst
78510.description:
From the back of the book (in Swedish):

Den nidländska reningen har inletts. Ni befinner er i Landori, altsedan pegasen Enulisor räddade er undan döden vid Helvesfortets sprängning. Landoris alvkonung talar: "Vicotnik har erövrat Krun, Hynsolge och Cereval på bare tre månader. Effekten för desse länder är förödande skåda!"

Han gör en gest och omdelelbart framträder en bild på skogstjärnens spegelblanka yta och man kan ana ljudet av stål som slår mot stål och skriken från värnlösa kvinnor. Bilder av brinnande ålrar och massavrättningar avlöser varandra.

"Snart står hoppet endast till Berendien, men Berendiens konung är svag och handlingsförlamad. Endast hans forskjutna dotter Melindor kan rädda landet, men hon befinner sig I Hynsolge, backom fiendens linjer. Kan ni rädda henne?"

"Melindors återkomst" är den fristående första delen av triologin "Den nidländska reningen" - en episk hjälteberättelse där NI är hjältarna.

User translation:

Title: The Return of Melindor

The Nidlandic Cleansing has begun. You are in Landori, ever since the pegasus Enulisor saved you from certain death at the destruction of "Helvetesfortet". Landori's elf king speaks: "Vicotnik has conquered Krun, Hysnolge and Cereval in just three months. The effect on these lands have been devastation and ruin!"

He makes a gesture and images appear on the surface of the forest lake, one can hear the sound of steel striking steel and the screams of defenceless women. Flashing images of burning fields and mass executions.

"Soon will Berendien be our only hope, but Berendien's king is weak. Only his lost daughter Melindor can save this land, but she is in Hynsolge, behind enemy lines. Can you save her?"

"Melindors återkomst" is the independent second part of the trilogy "The Nidlandic Cleansing" - an epic tale were YOU are the heroes.

78511.name: Icebreaker
78511.description:
Icebreaker is a 1995 strategy/action video game developed by Magnet Interactive Studios for the 3DO Interactive Multiplayer console. Despite the critical acclaim, the game did not sell well (mostly because of 3DO's failure on the 32-bit video game market). Later, the game was also ported to Mac and PC, where it found a similar fate. Icebreaker 2 was created but never released and, until recently, could only be played at creator Andrew Looney's house in a custom built arcade style machine.

Andrew Looney's Icebreaker 2 was made available for the 3DO by Older Games as of August 3, 2007. By December 2007, Older Games had been purchased and is no longer selling the game.

The gameplay consists of the player controlling a sliding white pyramid (named "Dudemeyer" on the readme of the computer version) on an isometric/diametric projection level. The goal of the game is to eliminate the several other types of pyramids (called "dudes" on the readme), some that move and others that don't. Each kind of enemy pyramid has its own weakness and specific form to be destroyed, and a great part of the game's challenge comes from this aspect.

The game consists of 150 different levels. A demo version was created which contains 5 representative levels from various parts of the game, and as of early 2008, either still is or recently was available from the website of Andrew Looney's game company Looney Labs.

Source: Wikipedia, Icebreaker (video game), available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78512.name: Front Mission 4
78512.description:
User Summary:

Set 6 years after the Huffman Conflict of the original Front Mission, Front Mission 4 drops you in the year 2096 in the middle of a brewing political conflict. The story switches you back-and-forth between two point-of-view storylines which really fleshes out the background characters and villains. Story aside, the main part of the game to love is the battle mechs, called Wanzers, that you purchase, outfit, and then pilot onto the battlefield. Each piece of your Wanzer has strengths, limitation, and weight, all of which must be balanced if you are to have any chance at victory in the battles ahead. On top of customizing your Wanzer, you also update your pilots with their own set of skills that will aid them on the battlefield. Battles take place in a turn-based 3D grid, and range from moderately challenging to downright frustrating at times.

Front Mission 4 was released for the Playstation 2 in the US in 2004.

78513.name: SOCOM 3: U.S. Navy SEALs

videogamehonor.31784: 2005 Game Critics Best Online Multiplayer of the Year Nominee

78513.description:
SOCOM 3 is a third-person tactical shooter that combines the elements of strategy, stealth, reflex and hand-eye coordination. There are 14 different single-player missions.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SOCOM_3:_U.S._Navy_SEALs," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78514.name: Arc the Lad: Twilight of the Spirits
78514.description:
From Back of EU PS2 edition box

Rivalry must be forgotten. The Spirits are calling.

As an evil arms sweeps the globe in a bid to achieve complete dominance, the fate of two rival races lies in the hands of Kharg and Darc, twin brothers separated at birth. After wildly different upbringings, Kharg is now a human prince; Darc a lowly, tormented Deimos slave.

Neither knows of the other's existence; nor do they understand that soon they must defend their people from the intruding darkness, no matter what the cost...

- An epic RPG with a twisting plot - seen from the viewpoints of two brothers in a series of episodic, concurrent adventures

- Innovative turn-based combat engine - make strategic use of terrain, spells, items and group attacks

- Diverse party of playable characters each with upgradeable weapons, items, skills and special attacks

78515.name: Alcatraz
78515.description:
Alcatraz is a computer game created by 221B Software Developments and published by Infograms. It was released on DOS, Atari ST and Commodore Amiga in 1992, and is a spiritual sequel to Infograms earlier espionage game, Hostages, released on various popular formats of the time. It came with a code sheet, in which you had to enter the correct code as soon as the game has loaded, to try and curb the rampant piracy that was prevailant at the time.

Plot
Two Special Forces operatives land on Alcatraz Island, once the former prison, to bring down a notorious drugs trafficker, Miguel Tardiez. Alcatraz has been taken over by the self-proclaimed warlord, and turned it into his base of operations for his drugs cartel, gun running and money laundering operations. The two operatives, Bird and Stone, must make their way from one end of the island, to the other, eliminating Tardiez's men, destroying the narcotics and, finally, apprehending, or dispatching, Tardiez, then making their escape via he awaiting Helicopter, all within 2 hours upon reaching their intrusion point.

Gameplay
The game takes place over a number of levels, which changes it's perspective to adjust to the corresponding mission, ie: inside buildings to find drugs, money and weapon caches, the viewpoint adjusts to first person mode, whilst many levels adopt the familiar side-scrolling perspective. You have various weapons at your disposal, like flame throwers, grenades and machine guns, which the henchmen will drop when you dispatch them. Another feature implemented into the game is that of stealth. When Tardiez's henchmen appear, or even before, you can hide in the shadows of doorways, over and behind walls and in areas of complete darkness. This also allows you to switch between any available weapons you have on your person. The whole game takes place within a time limit of just 2 hours. By that time, the waiting helicopter would have taken off, leaving you stranded on the island, with no way back to the mainland.

Critical reception
Amiga Action (31 (Apr 1992)81%) said "Many people will find the gameplay outdated and will soon become bored with it" but said "If you were a fan of the original, the new offering will be right up your street". Whereas Amiga Computing (48 (May 1992)81%) were more positive, and commented "As a whole, Alcatraz is an improvement on Hostages" and that "The scrolly shooty bits are absolutely brilliant" and said that the 3D sections "are not as good, but still fun". Other scores from the publications at the time (all varying between April and September 1992): Amiga Format 35 (Jun 1992) 76%, Amiga Joker (Apr 1992) 78%, Amiga Mania (Sep 1992) 75% and Amiga Power 13 (May 1992) 73%

Source: Wikipedia, Alcatraz (video game), available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78516.name: The Game of Life (1998)

videogamehonor.29626: 1999 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Nominee

78516.description:
User Summary

Software version of the classic family board game. An animated board, spinner, and several gameplay enhancements add to the familiar goals of career/home/marriage and trying to amass the greatest wealth by game's end ("retirement").

78517.name: Great Greed
78517.description:
Great Greed (ビタミーナ王国物語, "Bitamina Kingdom Story") is an environmentally-themed RPG for the Nintendo Game Boy released by Namco in 1992.

The game's plot deals with a protagonist whose name you set, but referred to as "Sierra Sam" in the game's promotional materials. Sam, a resident of the "real world," is transported to the fictional world of Greene in order to prevent Biohazard Harry (simply referred to as "Bio-Haz" in the game) from continuing to pollute Greene, a world of seven nations. Sam finds himself stuck in Greene because Microwave, who brought him there in the first place, lost her power in the previous battle. Sam's adventures range from collecting debut records to helping to expose a corrupt politician.

Source: Wikipedia, Great Greed, available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78518.name: Shi Kin Jo
78518.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game in which you try to clear the screen of Mah Jong tiles by using your little chinese vampire character to push the tiles around and form pairs.

78519.name: Torarete Tamaruka!?
78519.description:
User Summary
Based on the Japanese movie of the same name you play as a security guard trying to protect clients homes from from being robbed. As a member of Perfect Security Service you have at your disposal a limited budget with which you need to buy traps. Once bought you set them around a house in the hope of stopping the thieves that then come and attack. If you succesfully foil their attempts you gain more money and move onto the next level.

78520.name: Buck Bumble
78520.description:
From the back of the box:

Take on the role of a cyborg bee who battles mutant insectoids in this flying shoot 'em up featuring complete freedom of movement in a 3D world! Advance through twenty challenging missions for a truly progressive gameplay experience. Let yourself be transported to another dimension as you view the world from a tiny insect perspective! Includes multiplayer death matches, a soccer option and over ten killer weapons. Rumble pack compatible.

78521.name: Shanghai II
78521.description:
User Summary
6 stages and three modes (solitaire, tournament & challenge) of Mah Jong puzzle action. Match tiles from the pile to remove them and reveal tiles on lower levels. Clear all tiles to win.
2 player challenge mode needs two consoles, two cartridges and the Game Gear connector cable.

78522.name: A Bug's Life
78522.description:
From the back of the box:

Are You Bug Enough?
As hopeful hero Flik, you're the colony's last chance against the seed-grubbing grasshoppers. Run, fly, kick, squish, and slide through 15 challenging levels of 3-D animated gameplay. Outmaneuver 13 types of enemies, including The Bird and her deadly beak. Then, throw your weight around with tough antics like the Berry Attack and the Butt-Bounce. Because on this ride, you'll need more than just high hopes.

- Search for power-ups, tokens and objects to use in the "Living World."
- Get a bug's-eye-view of a magical 3-D world.
- Swing, fly, slide and navigate Flik through immense bug-infested levels.

78523.name: Fatal Run

videogameversion.139400: Android (Atari Greatest Hits Atari 2600 Emulation) edition

78523.description:
Game box

The year is 2089. A collision with a comet has left the earth reeling from radiation poisoning. There's little hope for humanity's survival. It's up to you to rescue the few remaining people. You must leave the protective fortress Albagon and deliver the newly developed radiation vaccine to the survivors. Your journey will not be an easy one. Nefarious henchmen are waiting to knock you off and steal the vaccine to ensure they will survive to rule the planet. Replenish your weapons, armour, and fuel in the cities - if there are any survivors to sell you supplies.
You must then find the rocket poised to launch a satellite that can nullify the effects of this cosmic accident that turned the world upside down. If you are sharp enough to learn the secret code words and live long enough to use them, you can launch the rocket and save the world.

78525.name: Puzzle Dimension
78525.description:
Brain exercise in 3D - Train your spatial visualization ability by navigating increasingly complex 3D puzzles.

The objective "pick all the sunflowers" sounds simple - but Puzzle Dimension is not your ordinary game world. Here up and down are relative terms as the gravity depends on where you roll the ball.

Your progression changes the audiovisuals - the retro look explodes in a fountain of pixels, revealing HD visuals. The music reacts to your progress by blending between crystal clear music and 8-bit retro-style chip tunes.

Solve the 100 puzzles by navigating maze-like winding 3D structures.

Unlock alternate graphical themes and compare your score with other players on the leaderboards.

Source: The Game Website.

78526.name: Soccer League Winner's Cup
78526.description:
User Summary

Play against the computer or a friend to win the 'Unmi Cup'. Choose from one of eight national teams - Japan, West Germany, Brazil, France, Korea, UK, Argentina and America - select you formation and master the techniques of sliding, heading and and over head kicks.

78527.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: MSVS
78527.description:
User Summary
As an Anaheim Electronics pilot you must take control of a Mobile Suit and use your brains and skill to complete missions. Over 70 types of Mobile Suit and 250 types of weapon make an appearance.
Do battle against a friend using the connector cable to link up 2 Wonderswans.

78528.name: Super Robot Wars Compact
78528.description:
Source: Wikipedia, List of Super Robot Wars games by system#Bandai WonderSwan.2FWonderSwan Color , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

The first Super Robot Wars to feature the "Select Scenario" system, which allows the player to decide the order which stages are played. The only other Super Robot Wars, aside from the first, to not feature a "Banpresto Original" design in any form or fashion.

78529.name: Destruction Derby
78529.description:
From the back of the box:

With no rules, no limits and no pit stopping, anything goes in this collision course of crumple zones, hit & run mayhem, and street level slamming where wrecking your opponent’s motor in ultra-realistic smashes and crashes is the name of the game. Take on the rigours of a full Championship season and pit your wits against a motley crew of psycho-waster racers such as the Suicide Squaddies, Skum and The Optician as you storm up the rankings from Rookie to Pro.
Reckon you can handle it?

Destruction Derby works with a serial link cable for two player head to head action.

78530.name: Lugaru: The Rabbit's Foot
78530.description:
Lugaru: The Rabbit's Foot (pronounced Loo-GAH-roo) is the first commercial video game created by Wolfire Games. It is a cross-platform, 3D action adventure game for Microsoft Windows, Mac OS X, Linux. It features Turner, an anthropomorphic rabbit with curiously well-developed combat skills.

Lugaru was made almost solely by David Rosen, including the game engine, models, animations and story. It was one of the first independently-produced video games to employ ragdoll physics. It uses a new and fairly intuitive combat system, basing attacks and counters on timing and context rather than different key combinations. It tended to be well-reviewed and was fairly well-received among the shareware community, especially among Mac users. Tim Soret would later improve the games textures, and Wolfire currently sells this version as Lugaru HD.

Source: Wikipedia, Lugaru, available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78531.name: Imagine (Issue 4 - Jul 1983)
78531.description:
Imagine
Adventure Games Magazine
Issue #4
July 1983

Cover art by Angus McKie.

78532.name: Devil World
78532.description:
Players control Tamagon, a green dragon who decides to "attack the Devil's World", along with a red Player 2 version of him. He navigates through a series of mazes and touches Crosses to power up and summon the ability to breathe fire and eat the dots in the maze. Without a cross, he is completely helpless, and cannot complete the maze. The large winged demon simply called "the Devil" dances at the top of the screen, pointing the direction for his minions to move the maze. This can be dangerous, as Tamagon can be squished by getting caught between a maze wall and the moving outer boundary. After the first maze is cleared, the next objective is to get four Bibles, and put them into a seal. The Bibles give Tamagon the same powers as with the Crosses. After carrying them all into the seal, the Devil flies to the next maze. In between, a bonus maze shows up where Tamagon collects six Bonus Boxes under a time limit. The pattern then repeats.

Source: Wikipedia, Devil World , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78533.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 39 - 1992)
78533.description:
User summary

Publication date in the game world: Phex, 18 Hal.

Table of Contents are shown in the Linked Article module below.

78534.name: In Cold Blood
78534.description:
Game box

Tortured, betrayed, alone. John Cord used to be a government agent - but now he lies in prison, trying to piece together the shattered remnants of his fading memory before it's broken by his captors. The world political stage is set to explode and somewhere in Cord's mind is the key to freedom for all.
- Enter a world of espionage and intrigue as you piece together the memory of captured MI6 agent John Cord.
- Imaginative gameplay combining stealth action and covert operations, all framed in an intense, immersive adventure.
- Comes on 2 discs for Playstation. 3 discs for Windows

78535.name: F-1 Race
78535.description:
User summary:

F1-Race is racing game released for the Gameboy in 1990. The game is developed and released by Nintendo. In the game the player takes control of a formula 1 car and has to compete in a championship around the world. The player can choose between two types of cars. In the game the player can use a nitro to increase the speed. The game also implements slipstream, in such a way that when a player drives behind another car for some seconds, the max speed of the players car will increase for a few moments. This often enables the player to overtake that other car.

The game supports up to four players using a four player adapter which was included with some releases of the game.

78536.name: Soundvoyager
78536.description:
Soundvoyager is intended to be played using sound only, without looking at the console's screen. The game involves several different subgames, one of which has players trying to center a dot on a side scrolling stage on top of an invisible target by only using sounds from the left and right speakers to guide them and another involves the player driving the wrong way down a three lane road trying to dodge oncoming vehicles by listening to which lane they are in.

Source: Wikipedia, Bit Generations , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78537.name: Gungrave
78537.description:
[From back of EU PS2 edition box]

Destroy everything, Grave!

1,000,000,000 bullets used! Unprecedented exhilaration!

Easy to use controls that let you master moves like that of the coolest action movies! Jump sideways, forward and backwards while unloading bullets! Perform graceful dance-like shooting assaults or just swing your coffin away to take the enemy out!

Run in shooting and send 'em to their graves!
Everything in Gungrave can be shot!
Enemies will flail, cars will explode and bullet holes will be left in walls!
Destroying the environment is not just simple eye-candy, it's part of the game!

78538.name: Hey You, Pikachu!

videogamehonor.29664: 2001 D.I.C.E. Best Family Game of the Year Nominee (Console)

78538.description:
From the back of the box:

For the first time ever, you can actually talk to your favorite Pokemon. Tag along with Pikachu as it goes through its daily routines, taking field trips, going fishing and having picnics, becoming better friends with each passing day. Pikachu will hear and react to the words you say. The more you speak the closer friends you'll be!

- Talk into the microphone, see Pikachu react. Your voice travels to Pikachu through the N64 Voice Recognition Unit and microphone - both included.
- Pal around with Pikachu - together you'll gather cooking ingredients, fish for favorite water Pokemon, and even hunt for buried treasure on a deserted island.
- Speak to Pikachu using a variety of key words and phrases. Friendship is based on communication, and there's plenty to talk about!

78539.name: Het Grote Bruid & Bruidegom Spel
78539.description:
A marriage themed trivia game.

Each player gets a marriage certificate card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the marriage certificate card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the marriage certificate card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

78540.name: Knife Edge: Nose Runner
78540.description:
From the back of the box:

"Command to Nose Gunner, Command to Nose Gunner. Radar's readin' an army of armored androids that are harshin' our Martian colonies. We're lookin' at boo-coo ground emplacements. Sulfur skies swarming with enemy gunships. F-f-f-four explosive gameplay modes for 1 to 4 players. And six super-vast battle stages with almost infinite paths to mutually assured destruction. It's a 3D shooter for N64 that makes the Big Bang look like a burp. So gimme full automatic cannons. Lock and load all special weapons. Set Autopilot for maximum warp. And try not to chuck your chimichangas. 'Cuz... we... are... goin'... in..."

78542.name: Het Grote Verjaardagsspel
78542.description:
Each player gets a birthday card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the birthday card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the birthday card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

78543.name: Digimon Adventure: Anode Tamer
78543.description:
User Summary

Enter into Digital World in order to save the 8 chosen children from the clutches of the powerful Millenniumon.
Collect, battle and evolve the many kinds of Digimon (short for digital monsters) that can be found in Digital world to help you on your quest.

Although Anode Tamer has the same story to it's sister title Cathode Tamer, there are slight differences in the enemy characters and found data between the two.

Two Wonderswans can be linked up to swap and battle digimon with other users.

78545.name: Het Grote Sudoku Spel
78545.description:
Players try to complete a Sudoku puzzle.

The first player tries to solve the puzzle. After 2 minutes the player passes the puzzle to the next player. Now that player has the chance to solve the Sudoku.
After 8 minutes the game ends. The player which filled in the most answers correctly wins the game.

78546.name: Het Grote Etiquette Spel
78546.description:
Each player gets a survey card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the survey card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the survey card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

78547.description:
Story
The Academy of Magic is a place where disciples of magic learn the art of magic.

Recently, mysterious cases have occurred, cases in which students and teachers have been brutally murdered.

These murders correspond to a legend that exists at the Acadamy regarding the conduct of a particular witch. Repeated tragedies at the Acadamy have made people aware that the legend of the existence of the 'Witch of the Acadamy' may indeed be true.

To get rid of the witch, 5 members of academy start the research about the legend of the Witch.

The aim of the members of this group is to find and to get rid of the witch.

By the way, the legend also says that the witch can transform into whomever the witch has killed.

This means there is always a question about, if one of the research members is already a witch.

Humans have their own magic which is different from magic users from far beyond the beginning of the academy. This magic is called "information"...

The frightful magic of the 'Witch of the Academy' can celebrate the murderer as a saint, and can execute a bonny innocent girl as a witch.

About this game

You become one of the 5 possible characters, and by gathering information about the witch, you try to contribute to the research and to become the most reliable character.

Also you must pay attention to the possibilities that one of the members is actually a witch, you may point out a member as a witch.

(In this game, you must discard a field card and take a field card.)

Discarded character card gives you information, while you point out a character as a witch by taking cards.


To tell the truth, there may be no witch amongst the members of the group. However, a character who is pointed out as being the witch may lose the trust of the rest of the players in the game and may be executed.

So it is important to gather information, but at the same time it is important to cast doubt on the other characters by spreading witch rumors, or by trying to avoid being accused of being the witch yourself. The winner is the person who survives the swirling eddy of information and misinformation surrounding the Witch Distrubance.
78547.name: Witchcraft

78548.name: Magical Tetris Challenge
78548.description:
From the back of the box (Gameboy version):

Join Disney's Mickey, Minnie, Donald and Goofy as they embark on a non-stop adventure full of challenging fun and excitement in Magical Tetris Challenge. Completely addictive, deceptively simple, you'll go wild in a kaleidoscopic shower of falling Tetris pieces in this magical version of the world's most popular video game.
- Combines Disney's world famous characters with Tetris, the all-time, best selling electronic puzzle game
- Three modes of play: Quest Mode, Game Collections Mode and 2-Player Mode
- Features 8 different versions of Tetris
- Uncover different story lines featuring your favorite Disney characters
- Play head-to-head against a friend using the Game Boy link cable

78549.name: Het Grote Film & Muziek Spel
78549.description:
Each player gets a jurysurvey card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the jurysurvey card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the jurysurvey card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

78550.name: Het Grote Kerst Spel
78550.description:
A christmas themed trivia game.

Each player gets a christmas card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the christmas card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the christmas card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

78551.name: Anchorhead
78551.description:
Anchorhead is the name of a 1998 interactive fiction computer game by Michael S. Gentry. It is loosely based on the Cthulhu mythos. Anchorhead takes place in a New England town by the same name that bears a resemblance to Innsmouth, Arkham, and other fictional towns created by H. P. Lovecraft.

Source: Wikipedia, Anchorhead %28video game%29 , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78552.name: Het Grote Spel: Culinair
78552.description:
Each player gets a menu card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and moving the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a question in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the menu card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the menu card.

When a player gets a correct answer for a category that he/she already had the Right-chip for, he/she may choose another player who also has a Right-chip for that category and force the other player to turn the chip over to its Wrong-side.

Whenever one of the players has collected chips for every category (it doesn't matter if they are Right or Wrong), the game ends and the player with the most Right-chips (correct answers) is the winner. In case of a draw the game continues until one player has the most Right-chips.

78553.name: Het Grote Puzzel & Crypto Spel
78553.description:
Each player gets a puzzle card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the puzzle card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the puzzle card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

78554.name: Imagine (Issue 5 - Aug 1983)
78554.description:
Imagine
Adventure Games Magazine
Issue #5
August 1983

Cover art by Tony O'Donnell.

78555.name: Mount & Blade: Warband

videogamehonor.21137: 2011 Charles S. Roberts Best Pre-20th Century Era Computer Wargame Nominee

78555.description:
Mount & Blade: Warband is the eagerly anticipated sequel for the game that brought medieval battlefields to life with its realistic mounted combat and detailed fighting system.

In a land torn asunder by incessant warfare, it is time to assemble your own band of hardened warriors and enter the fray. Lead your men into battle, expand your realm, and claim the ultimate prize: the throne of Calradia!

Features:

-Graphical overhaul: Support added for HDR, FSAA, depth of field, soft particles, tone mapping, and many other effects.
-Multiplayer battles with up to 64 players. Multiplayer modes include Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Capture the Flag, Conquest, Battle, and Siege.
-New models with greater detail and high-quality textures.
-A campaign allowing you to become the ruler of a faction and convince lords to become your vassals.

Source: The Publisher Website.

78556.name: Het Grote Oranje Spel
78556.description:
A Trivia game themed with the Dutch monarchy.

Each player gets a monarchy card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the monarchy card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the monarchy card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

78557.name: One Piece Treasure Wars
78557.description:
User Summary
A strange combination of board game, fighting and action based on the Japanese animation "One Piece." Roll a die to move around the map looking for treasure. Once you find some you have to run away from the other characters for a set amount of time in order to keep it. If another player catches up with you (or you catch another player with treasure) a battle ensues using a simple paper-rock-scissors system of attacks. The winner keeps the treasure and goes on the run again. Choose from 6 playable characters each with different moves and stories.
2 Wonderswans can be linked together for 2 player action.

78558.name: Imagine (Issue 6 - Sep 1983)
78558.description:
Table of Contents:

p2, The Beginners' Guide to Role-Playing Games, our feature for the new player, with Nic Novice
p5, Stirge Corner, by Roger Musson, a guide for the inexperienced player
p7, The Thief-Acrobat, by Gary Gygax, a new split class for characters with high strength and dexterity
p11, Dome of Whispers, by Ian Watson, original adventure fiction
p19, Illuminations, news from the world of games
p21, Jack of All Trades, by Roger Hall, a scenario for the D&D, AD&D and DRAGONQUEST games

Players' Association News, a magazine within a magazine, edited by Mike Brunton.
p31, PAN Pipings
p32, Dispel Confusion
p32, Turnbull Talking
p34, Rubic of Moggedon

p35, Film Reviews, by Colin Greenland
p36, Chain Mail, by Brian Creese, a new regular feature on postal gaming
p38, Tavern Talk, by Pete Tamlyn
p38, Letters, Clubs and Forthcoming Events
p40, Fanzines
p40, European Illuminati
p42, Games Reviews, adventure games under the spotlight
p46, The Sword of Alabron, Cartoon Adventure by Ian Williamson
cover, Fair at Dragon Post, by Emmanuel

78559.name: Mortal Kombat Trilogy

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

78559.description:
From the back of the box (Nintendo 64 version):

This Game is on FIRE!
Shao Kahn's final attempt to control the earth is upon us...
- 26 immediately Playable Character plus 4 hidden Characters!
- The new Agressor Kombat Mode arms the quick & merciless with more strength and power to inflict heavy damaging combinations!
- Over 30 Moves and "-Alities" never seen in the arcade!
- New Brutalities let you pound opponents 'till they explode!
- New 3 on 3 Kombat Mode delivers a marathon fight-to-the-finish!
- 7 humiliating Stage Fatalities that send defeated opponents plummeting out of the arena to a grisly death!

...You have no choice. Defeat Kahn's deadly Warriors or die trying.

78560.name: Sorobangu
78560.description:
User Summary
Based vaguely on an abacus the game presents you with beads spradically dotted across a grid pattern. You must slide the grid lines horizontally and vertically in order to create blocks of three or more beads of the same colour in order to make them disappear. Clear the whole screen without your miss counter depleting to pass the stage.
Two Wonderswans can be linked together for two player action.

78561.name: Monty on the Run
78561.description:
"Monty on the Run is a computer game created by the software house Gremlin Graphics and released in 1985 for the C64, Spectrum, Amstrad CPC and Commodore Plus/4, written by Peter Harrap for the Spectrum with music by Rob Hubbard.

On the run from the authorities after his intervention in the Miners' strike, Monty the mole must escape from his house and head for the English Channel and freedom in Europe. In traditional platform game fashion, along the way he needs to collect various objects and solve puzzles to complete his escape. Before the game, five objects must be chosen to form Monty's Freedom Kit. Choosing the wrong items will leave the player unable to pass certain screens. This also acted as an anti-piracy measure, since the objects were only given numbers onscreen meaning the player had to refer to the accompanying manual. The final screen sees Monty boarding a ferry to France. This was then the starting point for the follow-up Auf Wiedersehen Monty.

The game has a similar sense of British surrealness to Manic Miner and Jet Set Willy - in gameplay it is more similar to the latter. Enemies patrol every screen, water is deadly to the touch and Monty runs the risk of being squashed by the many pistons."

Source: Wikipedia, Monty on the Run , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Individual credits:
Rob Hubbard: Music (C64)

78562.name: Anarchy
78562.description:
from the publisher's website

Anarchy may be described as a fast and furious parody of trick-taking games, the point being that you all play at once instead of going through the laborious and time-consuming process of taking turns - which of course is undemocratic, conferring an unearned privilege on whoever goes first, and being therefore suitable only for the decadent entertainment of a hierarchic-élitist society.

Each player chooses a card and then they are all flipped at the same time. The player with the highest card of each suit wins the other cards of that suit that were also played during that hand. If there is only one of a suit, it is compared to the other individual cards and the player with the highest card collects them all.

At the start of the turn, you must decide what you are playing for. You can try and simply collect the most cards or go for a specific color, suit or the least amount of cards. The more specific you option the more points you get at the end of the round, which occurs once all cards have been played.

The game is played to a specific amount of points and once a player reaches that number, they are declared the winner.

78563.name: Blue Chairs
78563.description:
User Summary

Blue Chairs is a text adventure by Chris Klimas. It is playable on zcode interpreters. The game has surreal hallucinogenic passages, the player character must buy and consume a strange drug at the start of the game.

Game Prologue

"Twenty-three dollars," he's saying, "Twenty-three dollars for the best dream of your life."

78564.name: Troll-Blade (1st Edition)
78564.description:
Publisher's description:

TROLL-BLADE. One SINGLE page. One FULL fantasy RPG.

In the tradition of both 1km1kt’s Adventurer rpg and R(age), P(recognition), G(race), the TROLL-BLADE PLAYER’S GUIDE presents both the rules AND the character sheet on the SAME sheet of paper. Old-skool adventuring in the spirit of red box D’n'D and Fighting Fantasy – requires dice and pencils!

78565.name: Troll-Blade (2nd Edition)
78565.description:
Publisher's description:

TROLL-BLADE 2nd edition.

One single page could never hope to hold it. Expanded from both previous releases to a MASSIVE 13 pages, TB2 provides the most comprehensive (and compacted) rules in FRPG. FIVE races, FOUR classes, TWENTY-THREE spells, limitless monsters and magic item creation are all included. Old-skool gaming never had this clarity. Enjoy.

78566.name: Gunpey Ex
78566.description:
User Summary
The colour sequal to the original Wonderswan Gunpey game. Move line segments (forward slash, backwards slash, mountain line, valley line) up and down to create a complete line that spans the whole screen width. Get bonus points for creating lines of the same colour.
New special attacks in two player mode that block out various parts of your opponents screen. Two wonderswans must be linked for 2 player mode.

78567.name: Audiosurf
78567.description:
Audiosurf is a music-adapting puzzle racer where you use your own music to create your own experience. The shape, the speed, and the mood of each ride is determined by the song you choose.
You earn points for clustering together blocks of the same color on the highway, and compete with others on the internet for the high score on your favorite songs.

Source: The Game Website.

78568.name: Summer Games
78568.description:
"Summer Games is a sports video game developed by Epyx and released by U.S. Gold based on sports featured in the Summer Olympic Games. Released in 1984 for the Commodore 64, it was also eventually ported to the Apple II, Atari 2600, Atari 7800, Atari XL/XE and Sega Master System platforms. Amiga, ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC and Atari ST versions were also created for inclusion in compilations. In 2004 it would be "re-released" on the C64 Direct-to-TV.

The events available vary slightly depending on the platform, and may include:
Pole vault
Platform diving
Sprinting
Gymnastics
Freestyle swimming
Skeet shooting
Rowing
The game allowed the player to compete in all of the events sequentially, choose a few events, choose just one event, or practice an event."

Source: Wikipedia, Summer Games , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78569.name: Forsaken
78569.description:
"Forsaken is a 3D first person shooter video game. The game was developed by Probe Entertainment for the Microsoft Windows and PlayStation and by Iguana UK for the Nintendo 64, and distributed by Acclaim Entertainment. The game was released on April 30, 1998 in North America, June 3, 1998 in Europe & Australia, and in 1999 in Japan.

Similar to Descent, Forsaken had a strong following due to its "six degrees of freedom" gameplay, but suffered in popularity to the conventional ground-based 3D first-person shooter games because of its challenging nature.

In the distant future, the advancement of science has exceeded humanity's ability to control it. During a subatomic experiment, an accident causes an uncontrollable fusion reaction, utterly destroying the surface of the planet Earth.

One year later, Earth has been classified as "condemned" by the ruling imperial theocracy, meaning that it is now legal for anyone to salvage anything left on the planet. Mercenaries from all over come to raid the dead planet, forced to battle not only each other, but the robot sentinels that the government has left behind."

Source: Wikipedia, Forsaken (video game) , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78570.name: Shaq Fu
78570.description:
"Shaq Fu is a fighting game released on the Sega Mega Drive/Genesis, Sega Game Gear, Super Nintendo, and Game Boy game platforms on October 28, 1994. It was later ported to the Amiga platform, exclusively in Europe. The game was published by Electronic Arts and developed by the now-defunct Delphine Software. It features professional basketball player Shaquille O'Neal as a playable character.

In the game's storyline, Shaquille O'Neal wanders into a kung fu dojo while heading to a charity basketball game in Tokyo, Japan. There, he stumbles into another dimension, where he must rescue a young boy named Nezu from the evil mummy Sett-Ra."

Source: Wikipedia, Shaq Fu , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78571.name: Gungrave Overdose
78571.description:
From back of EU PS2 edition box

UNDEAD and UNSTOPPABLE.

GUNGRAVE: Overdose is a high-octane shooter where everything in sight is yours for the taking. Choose between the wrathful swordsman Juji Kabane, the relentless rock star Rocketbilly Redcadillac or the undead hero Beyond the Grave.

GUNGRAVE: Overdose explodes on-screen with 9 stages, 53 minutes of movies and an onslaught of mayhem that never lets up.

Choose from three havoc-wreaking characters, including Beyond the Grave, seen here kicking ass.

Kill with elegance to gain points and unlock hidden moves.

Take on multiple opponents and have Grave dispense death, demolition and destruction.

78572.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 2009
78572.description:
Pro Evolution Soccer 2009 (abbreviated as PES 2009) is a football video game in the Pro Evolution Soccer series by Konami. It is also the exclusive licenced game of the UEFA Champions League. Gameplay has been changed for Pro Evolution Soccer 2009, with key additions to the Teamvision system, tactics change according to situation, off-the-ball fluency AI recognizing strategies that works accumulating data on an ongoing basis within Master League and League modes. Another new addition is the readjustments for ball movements. PES 2009 has new air resistance calculations for the trajectory of the ball. There are also new friction routines to affect ball movement in terms of ground conditions, backspin routines are calculated so that ball slows accordingly, and the bounce of the ball can be used more effectively: players can flick the ball up to tee a shot, or to lift it over a defender's trailing leg. If a player has the ability, they will be able to perform skillful turns. PES 2009 also features a new game mode called 'Become A Legend', much like 'Be a Pro' from the EA Sports FIFA Series.

Source: Wikipedia, Pes 2009 , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78573.name: Tales of the World: Radiant Mythology
78573.description:
From back of EU PSP edition box

Will you be the world's last hope in a dark battle for survival?

- Customise your character in hundreds of ways by changing your clothes, voice and more.
- Real-time battle system allows you to attack from anywhere on the battlefield.
- Wirelessly exchange weapons and armor with your friends while on the go!
- Enlist help from Luke and Tear from "Tales of the Abyss" and other characters from previous Tales games.

Bring the exotic journey, intense battles and heroic quests everywhere and anywhere you go.

78574.name: Gormiti: The Trading Card Game
78574.description:
From back of box...

Our world is threatened by the Volcano Gormiti, frightening creatures from the parallel dimension of Gorm. Four adolescents will face the elemental monsters and ally with the Gormiti of Earth, Forest, Air and Sea. Transforming into Super Gormiti, Toby, Nick Jessica and Lucas are going to Gorm to try and save the Earth!

Inspired by the animation series of the same name, Gormiti: The Trading Card Game sees the different factions of the Island of Gorm face each other in epic battles!

Live out the battles of titans in a parallel universe!

Gormiti is a Trading Card Game for two players. The goal is to deplete all of your opponents energy orbs by attacking them with monsters that you play each turn.
Players construct their own deck of cards from their collections and use them to battle each other. Each turn you can recruit new beasts and attack your opponent with monsters you have played previously.
When battling you opponent may block your attacker with one of their monsters from their defence zone. Compare your attack stat to the defenders resistance stat and see who wins. If you attack and are unopposed then you destroy one of your opponents energy orbs. Destroy 5 or 6 (depending on who went first) and you win.

78575.name: Dragon Ball Z: Ultimate Battle 22
78575.description:
User Summary
1 on 1 beat em up featuring 22 characters from the Dragon Ball Z universe. Characters featured are:
Super Goku, Gohan, Goten, Trunks, Gotrunks, Supertrunks, Piccolo, Krilin, Ten Chin Han, Great Saiyaman, Kaiohshin, Vegeta, Zarbon, Likum, Genious, Frieza, C18, C16, Cell, Dabura, Majin Boo and Super Bou.

78576.name: Wild Arms XF (Crossfire)
78576.description:
[From back of US PSP edition box]

Get caught in the crossfire!

Come along with an all-new cast and storyline as a favourite series goes portable for the first time!

Dive into an intriguing tale in which one family's personal vendetta grows into an epic struggle to save the world!

- Experience an incredibly deep strategic adventure featuring over 60 stages plus many optional battles!

- Customise your party endlessly with over 20 unique and varied job classes.

- Create powerful weapons, armor and spell books from rare materials scavenged by your hired mercenaries.

- Enjoy the game's soundtrack at any time with the bonus Music Library.

78578.name: Mega Man 9
78578.description:
"Mega Man 9 (ロックマン9 野望の復活!! Rokkuman 9: Yabō no Fukkatsu!!, lit. Rockman 9: Revival of Ambition!!) is a platform game developed by Capcom and Inti Creates. It is the ninth game in the original Mega Man series, and the first series re-release (not counting spin-offs) since the 1998 game and 2002 release of Mega Man & Bass. The game was published by Capcom in 2008 on the PlayStation Network, WiiWare and Xbox Live Arcade. Mega Man 9 continues Mega Man's fight against Dr. Wily and his robot creations.

Although the game was developed for modern consoles, Mega Man 9 uses graphics and sounds similar to the Nintendo Entertainment System as a throwback to the earlier games in the series. The cover art, too, is a nod to the covers of the early Western titles. The game was a commercial success and received mostly positive reviews from critics, which prompted Capcom to follow the game up with a sequel, Mega Man 10."

Source: Wikipedia, Mega Man 9 , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78579.name: Mega Man 10
78579.description:
"Mega Man 10 (ロックマン10 宇宙からの脅威!! Rokkuman 10: Uchū kara no Kyōi!!, lit. Rockman 10: Threat From Outer Space!!) is the tenth main entry of the classic Mega Man series (not including Mega Man & Bass). Like its predecessor, Mega Man 9, it is a downloadable title for the same services -- WiiWare, PlayStation Network, and Xbox Live Arcade - and is based on the 8-bit look and feel of the NES titles."

Source: Wikipedia, Mega Man 10 , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78580.description:
The Munchkin Dice of Protection is a pair of 6-sided dice.


From the package





You may start a game of Munchkin with up to two Munchkin d6 Dice.Place the first die on an Item you have in play. That Item can not be stolen, lost, sold, etc. unless you allow it.

When you roll to Run Away, roll the second one. If your roll is equal to the value of the first die, you may escape automatically be sacrificing the Item underneath it. Discard it.







Unofficial

These dice were not properly licensed through Steve Jackson Games and were recalled almost immediately. They cannot be used in official Munchkin games.


Other

Part of the Munchkin series
78580.name: Munchkin Dice Of Protection

78581.name: Skyfox
78581.description:
Skyfox is a 1984 action computer game developed by Ray Tobey and published by Electronic Arts. Ariolasoft published the game in Europe. Originally developed for the Apple II, it was ported to the ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64 and Macintosh in 1985 and to the Amiga and Atari ST in 1986. The game was produced by Stewart Bonn, and Richard Hilleman also supported Ray Tobey's work; both would later become high-ranking EA product development executives.

In this game, the player pilots the Skyfox, the most advanced attack fighter plane available to the fictional government, the Federation. The plane's armaments consist of radar guided missiles, deflection shields, laser cannons, heat-seeking missiles and a top speed of Mach 4. The gameplay consists of fighting tanks, enemy planes and the enemy motherships. The game has a total of 15 scenarios and 5 skill levels.

Featuring a view from the cockpit of the jet, this game is recognized as popularizing this view. The cockpit featured radar which showed incoming missiles and other threats. Flying above the clouds, the player fights hordes of enemy planes. Flying below them, the player is attacked by enemy tanks. Hailed upon its release, most criticisms of the game cited repetitive gameplay as the only drawback.

The game was followed by a sequel, Skyfox II: The Cygnus Conflict, set in space.

Tobey thought a player could get bored flying an advanced fighter plane, and might want to play a game. Consequently, he incorporated a Space Invaders game into Skyfox as a hidden Easter egg. Pressing Ctrl-G while flying activated the Space Invaders game.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skyfox,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78582.description:
The Munchkin Booty D6 Dice is a pair of 6-sided dice that were sold by themselves and in the Munchkin Booty Dice Set with a Munckin Booty Dice Bag, and a single Munchkin Booty D10 Dice.


From the Munchkin Booty D6 Dice package





If you use this die in a game of Munchkin Booty:[Hide the Booty]

At the end of your turn you may place cards underneath your Hide Away. You can hide a number of cards equal to your level.

These card are now considered out of the game for all purposes. You may retrieve any of them at any time during your turn, except during combat.

If you lose levels discard a random card from these for each level you lose.

The rules for Munchkin Dice & Wicked Munchkin Dice do not apply to this die.







From the Munchkin Booty Dice Set package





If you use this D6 die in a game of Munchkin Booty:If you are a pirate without a Ship, you may at any time during your turn, except during combat, take a Ship from the discard pile.

Place the die on the Ship. The Ship now has a value worth 0 Gold Pieces, but the die grants a combat bonus equal to your level. The die and the ship can be lost as any other ship.

In any other game of Munchkin the die acts as a Cheat card. Remove the die from the game after using it.

The rules for Munchkin Dice & Wicked Munchkin Dice do not apply to this die.







Unofficial

These dice were not properly licensed through Steve Jackson Games and were recalled almost immediately. They cannot be used in official Munchkin games.


Other

Part of the Munchkin series
78582.name: Munchkin Booty D6 Dice

78583.description:
The Munchkin Booty D10 Dice is a single 10-sided die that was sold by itself and in the Munchkin Booty Dice Set with a Munckin Booty Dice Bag, and a pair of Munchkin Booty D6 Dice.


From the Munchkin Booty D10 Dice package





If you use this die in a game of Munchkin Booty:If you are a pirate without a Ship, you may at any time during your turn, except during combat, take a Ship from the discard pile.

Place the die on the Ship. The Ship now has a value worth 0 Gold Pieces, but the die grants a combat bonus equal to your level. The die and the ship can be lost as any other ship.

In any other game of Munchkin the die acts as a Cheat card. Remove the die from the game after using it.

The rules for Muchkin Dice & Wicked Munchkin Dice do not apply to this die.







From the Munchkin Booty Dice Set package





If you use this D10 die in a game of Munchkin Booty:[Hide the Booty]

At the end of your turn you may place cards underneath your Hide Away. You can hide a number of cards equal to your level.

These card are now considered out of the game for all purposes. You may retrieve any of them at any time during your turn, except during combat.

If you lose levels discard a random card from thse for each level you loose.

The rules for Munchkin Dice & Wicked Munchkin Dice do not apply to this die.







Unofficial

These dice were not properly licensed through Steve Jackson Games and were recalled almost immediately. They cannot be used in official Munchkin games.


Other

Part of the Munchkin series
78583.name: Munchkin Booty D10 Dice

78584.name: Skyfox II: The Cygnus Conflict
78584.description:
Skyfox II: The Cygnus Conflict is a computer game developed by Electronic Arts in 1987 for the Commodore 64.

This arcade/strategy/flight simulation game is a sequel to the original Skyfox.

The game was reviewed in 1988 in Dragon #133 by Hartley, Patricia, and Kirk Lesser in "The Role of Computers" column. The reviewers gave the game 4 out of 5 stars.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skyfox_II:_The_Cygnus_Conflict," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78585.name: Halley Wars
78585.description:
Game box

Lord Halley's forces are making their sixth attack on the earth. You and your attack spacecraft are their only obstacle.

78586.name: Take Your Best Shot
78586.description:
From the Manual
At the CD-ROM 'Take Your Best Shot' you will find:
- Best shot: Get back at bosses!
- Head Shot: Knock these ugly mugs out!
- Hot Shot: The object of this game is to clear all the bricks in each wall without losing the ball.
- Line Shot: A twisted Baseball Game.

78587.name: Storm
78587.description:
From the back of the game inlay.

A thrilling, highly addictive arcade adventure. 1 or 2 players (Storm and Agravain Undead) must pit their wits against the traps laid by Una Cum and fearfully battle against his evil minions. Keyboard only.

78588.name: Yu-Gi-Oh! Worldwide Edition: Stairway to the Destined Duel
78588.description:
Yu-Gi-Oh! Worldwide Edition: Stairway to the Destined Duel is based on the popular Yu-Gi-Oh! trading card game and TV series has you set during the Battle City arc, dueling popular characters from the anime and manga. The main objective of the game is to build a strong deck from cards won after duels from the main cast from the English second season anime.

Source: Wikipedia, Yu-Gi-Oh! Worldwide Edition: Stairway to the Destined Duel , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78589.name: Headcoach
78589.description:
User summary:

Basic version of American Football, featuring a league with 24 teams. Play options on offense were limited to three choices (run, pass and line plunge). There was also no punt option.

At the end of each season a draft took place and players could strengthen their teams by bringing in new players and coaching.

78590.name: Star Wars: Racer Revenge
78590.description:
"Star Wars Racer Revenge is a Star Wars video game that involves high speed racing. It is the sequel to Star Wars: Episode I Racer. This game takes place in between episodes 1 and 2. The story takes place eight years after The Phantom Menace, and Sebulba wants revenge on Anakin Skywalker. Unlike its predecessor, you aren't able to continue racing if you crash your pod, perhaps for added realism."

Source: Wikipedia, Star Wars: Racer Revenge , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78591.name: Monty Python's Complete Waste of Time
78591.description:
Monty Python's Complete Waste of Time is a collection of minigames, screen savers, desktop wallpaper and icons for Mac OS System 7, DOS and Windows. The content is drawn primarily from the Monty Python's Flying Circus TV series. It also features specially-written and recorded interstitial and linking material created by some of the Python members and Secret Policeman's Ball producer Martin Lewis. Overall producer was Bob Ezrin.
Source: Wikipedia, "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monty_Python's_Complete_Waste_of_Time]," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78592.name: Legend: Ashita e no Tsubasa
78592.description:
User Summary
The peace of Legendaria has been shattered by the arrival of the demon hordes of Yoberu's Millenium - a time of darkness and fear.
Only those that know the meaning of the true word 'Mantou' will have the power to dispell Yoberu's Millenium. Unfortunately the knowledge of the word only survives as parts of legends and tales. You must venture out to seek the true meaning and return the land to it's former glory.

78593.name: Legendz: Yomigaeru shiren no shima
78593.description:
User Summary
Based on an anime and manga of the same name Legendz is a pokemonesque rpg. Legendz are legendary beasts that have had their sould trapped in 'Soul Dolls'. At the start of the game a secretive company called DarkWise Company have learnt how to release the trapped souls and have created a themepark island, Legendz Park, where kids from all over the world can gather and have there own adventures with the Legendz. You, as the hero, have been given a ticket to Legendz Park and a Soul Doll by your parents for your birthday.
The game comes packaged with a Soul Doll Adaptor and 1 Soul Doll. Once connected to the GBA the trapped Legendz is released into the game.
Extra Soul Dolls were sold seperately.

78594.name: Soul Doll Adaptor
78594.description:
User Summary

For use with the game Legendz: Yomigaeru shiren no shima.
An Adaptor that plugs into the GBA and allows information to be transferred from the collectible Soul Doll figures to the game, releasing new monsters to play with.

78595.name: American Civil War: Gettysburg
78595.description:
Test your military muscles in this turn-based strategy game, set against the backdrop of one of the most famous battles in American history. The Battle of Gettysburg, fought July 1–3, 1863, in and around the town of Gettysburg, Pennsylvania, was the battle with the largest number of casualties in the American Civil War and is often described as the war's turning point.

(From publisher & Wiki)

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Gettysburg,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78597.name: Legendz: Soul Dollz

videogamehwversion.56169: Pack 1 (Reppuu no Shisha) Legendz: Soul Dollz

78597.description:
User Summary

The first expansion pack for Legendz: Yomigaeru Shiren no Shima. It contains 3 plastic Soul Dollz - Willo Wisp, Wind Dragon B and Werewolf. The figures all contain an information chip that when plugged into the GBA via the Soul Doll Adapter will allow the monsters to be used in game.

The second expansion pack for Legendz: Yomigaeru Shiren no Shima. It contains 3 plastic Soul Dollz - Mermaid, Blaze Dragon (B) & Tornado King Dragon. The figures all contain an information chip that when plugged into the GBA via the Soul Doll Adapter will allow the monsters to be used in game.

78599.name: Castle Adventure
78599.description:
User Summary
Castle Adventure is a Dungeon Adventure. It lacks a backstory, but it is soon discovered that the player is locked within a Castle and must fight many fiends as well as solve various puzzles in order to find his way to freedom. High scores are attained by finding as much treasure as possible, and are recorded for later viewing.

The game was originally released in 1984 under the name Castle Adventure, and was later illegally released under the name Golden Wombat in Keystone Software's Swords and Sorcery compilation in 1987.

78600.name: Football
78600.description:
Football is played on 30x18 squares field. Each player has 11 players and there are 2 stacks of cards you need when a player enters a red or blue field.

Players choose the duration of the match (2x45' is suggested in the gamerules).
Each player determines the placing of his team, according to the normal rules of football.

In your turn you roll 1 normal and 1 special die. The normal die indicates how far you can advance 3 of your players. The special die indicates the direction they can run.

The player with most goals wins.

78601.name: James Bond 007: Agent Under Fire
78601.description:
"James Bond 007: Agent Under Fire is a first-person shooter video game based on the James Bond franchise. Developed and published by Electronic Arts, it was released for GameCube, PlayStation 2, and Xbox game consoles.

Agent Under Fire is the fourth Bond game which is not based on a film or book in the James Bond series. It follows Domark's James Bond: The Duel on the 8 and 16-bit Sega systems, Nintendo's Game Boy RPG James Bond 007 and EA's own 007 Racing."

Source: Wikipedia, Agent under fire , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78602.name: Yahtzee (2007)
78602.description:
Source: Boardgamegeek.
Yahtzee is a classic dice game played with 5 dice. Each player's turn consists of rolling the dice up to 3 times in hope of making 1 of 13 categories. Examples of categories are 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, straight, full house, etc. Each player tries to fill in a score for each category, but this is not always possible. When all players have entered a score or a zero for all 13 categories, the game ends and total scores are compared.

Manual
- Play solitaire versus the computer or with friends on the same computer.
- Double or triple your score by filling in the most strategic box on the scorecard.
- Use your 'power-ups' wisely and attain the level of Grandmaster. Power-ups can be used once during the game and can help you win or hinder your opponents.

Powerups: Helping Hand, Protection, Lucky Roll, Another Turn, Bad Luck, Massive Bad Luck, Score Blocker and Massive Score Blocker.

78603.name: WarioWare: Twisted
78603.description:
Source: Wikipedia, WarioWare: Twisted! , available under the CC-BY-SA License.
WarioWare: Twisted!, known in Japan as Mawaru Made in Wario (まわる メイドインワリオ) is a video game for Game Boy Advance by Nintendo. The game is of a variety and puzzle genre. It was not released in Europe, despite having been announced for release there.

In the game, Wario and his friend Dr. Crygor invent a Game Boy Advance that only reacts when tilted around. The game follows the WarioWare formula with a variety of games that lasts for only a few seconds. The cartridge utilizes a gyro sensor and players must spin and twist in order to play the games.The WarioWare: Twisted! cartridge has a built-in gyro sensor and rumble feature (for feedback during rotation). Most of the microgames are played by rotating the entire handheld device.

78604.name: Neverwinter Nights Gold Edition
78604.description:
Neverwinter Nights Gold Includes:

* The award-winning Neverwinter Nights
* The hit expansion pack, Shadows of Undrentide
* Game updates, enhancements and BioWare-created modules
* BioWare's Aurora Toolset, for easy mod and game creation

Source: The Developer Website.

78605.name: Dragon Buster
78605.description:
User Summary
Defeat the demon dragon to save the one you love, Princess Celia. This is a port of the side scrolling multi path Arcade game of the same name. It was one of the first games to feature a vitality (health) meter and the double jump.

78606.name: Konjiki no Gash Bell: Go Go Mamono Fight
78606.description:
This game is a cel-shaded Super Smash Brothers style game. There are a few game modes to choose from.
1. DEMONIC HORROR MODE: Select your character and battle it out in every stage against 3 random opponents each battle.
2. VERSUS MODE: First, decide if the mamono fight solo, or in teams. Next, decide how many will be in the brawl, then select your characters, arena, and even battle options and get fighting!
3. STORY MODE: Choose between either Gash's Story, Tio's Story, Kyanchome's Story, or Umagon's Story to play in.

Source: Wikipedia, Konjiki no Gash Bell!! Go! Go! Mamono Fight!! , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78607.name: Konjiki no Gash Bell: Yūjō Tag Battle Full Power

videogameseries.6918: Konjiki no Gash Bell: Yuujou Tag Battle

78607.description:
Konjiki no Gash Bell!! Yūjō no Tag Battle Full Power is a video game of the fighting game genre based on the Manga/Anime series Zatch Bell! released in 2004 by Bandai. The game was released only in Japan. Characters featured:
* Gash Bell and Kiyomaro Takamine (Zatch Bell and Kiyo Takamine)
* Tio and Megumi Oumi (Tia and Megumi Oumi)
* Brago and Sherry Belmont
* Kanchomé and Parco Folgore
* Kid and Doctor Nazonazo (Kido and Dr. Riddles)
* Umagon (Ponygon)
* Vincent Bari and Gustav
* Wonrei and Li-en
* Zeon and Dufaux (Zeno and Dufort)
* Akatsuki and Sakurada
* Wiseman and Kotoha

Source: Wikipedia, Konjiki no Gash Bell!! Y%C5%ABj%C5%8D no Tag Battle Full Power , available under the CC-BY-SA License.

78608.name: Fort Boyard The Quest
78608.description:
From the game box:

Melinda Messenger presets Fort Boyard The Quest

"That was the darkest of times at Ford Boyard, when hordes of half-human, half-animal creatures seized control of the Great Stone Vessel.These dreadful monsters were controlled by the evil Arok, who used his terrible powers to impose a reign of terror across the land. Then, one day, two brave souls appeared who would become the instruments of fate and attempt to defy the power of the Fort..." From Chronicles of the Fort

Enter the darkest depths of the Fort and tackle over 25 trap-laced cells
Take part in a quest to reveal the terrible secrets contained in the Fort
Gather clues from all over the Fort to lead you to the final confrontation
Use skill and logic to avoid specific traps held by each cell
Master all the weapons at your disposal and try to survive the many conflicts

78610.name: Anna Kournikova's Smash Court Tennis
78610.description:
Description from the back of the game box.

Combining Namco's classic addictive gameplay with the World's top tennis star, Anna Kournikova's smash court tennis is the last word in multi-player fun - exclusive to PlayStation.

- Learn all the real shots of tennis.
- Practice with comprehensive Training Mode!
- Multiple game modes, including Tournament, Street Tennis and the explosive Bomb Ball!
- Fantastic multi-player fun for 1-4 players.

78611.name: Corsairs Gold
78611.description:
from the game box:

Corsairs Gold

Launch yourself on a thrilling quest to the four corners of the globe, with new adventures in every port... By force of arms or by profitable trade, accumulate wealth for yourself and for your country.
